page.title: 13The Bryanston Arts Centre
page.content: AUDIENCES: the price of each event depends on the artist's fame. Tickets cost Â£2-Â£5. Performers enjoy coming to the BAC & find responsive audiences. It is common for companies to return. The Manager felt that events would be more supported if the BAC were in the town. There are few young members. Drama produces an audience, mime shows are popular, music less so especially if classical. Support from the school has also declined; the cause is said to be video/television habits. Since opening in 1966 tastes have changed: theatre "classics" are no longer a draw and only "commercial" shows guarantee audiences to fill the 542 seats. The Manager felt that in future perhaps only three or four major events a year might be staged instead of the present fortnightly events & the four day July festival.
